text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Sega Mark III is an 8-bit console produced by Sega in 1985 in Japan to compete with the NES. Then it will be redesigned and renamed as a Master System or SMS to be released in the rest of the world in 1986, one year after the release of the NES. Equipped with a 3.5 Mhz processor, 8 KB of RAM, 128 KB of video RAM and a 3-voice mono sound, it displays 256x192 pixels in 32 colors, 64 with a trick. In 1987, a new version was released in Japan, incorporating an FM module that could be used for games. But it will never catch up and will only be a real success in Europe and Brazil.
